translation.admin-edit-permissions-in: Edit user roles and permissions in
translation.create-deployment-subheader: Choose a nice name for your deployment, as it will also be its subdomain
translation.create-deployment-name-warning: Your deployment will be created with the name
translation.create-deployment-image-subheader: If you would like to use a prebuilt image, enter its name below. For example mongo, mongo:4.4 or quay.io/keycloak/keycloak
translation.create-deployment-custom-domain-subheade: Specify a custom domain. Add a CNAME record for this domain pointing to app.cloud.cbh.kth.se. If you are using Cloudflare or some other proxy service, disable the proxy so our DNS lookup resolves correctly. You can reenable the proxy after the deployment is created.
translation.create-deployment-env-subheader: Environment variables are accessible from inside your deployment and can be used to configure your application, store secrets, and more. Traffic will be sent to the port specified in the PORT environment variable. Change its value to the port your app is listening to
translation.create-deployment-persistent-subheader: Persistent storage allows data to be stored and accessed across multiple deployments.
translation.create-vm-no-resources: You do not have enough resources to create a VM. Please delete some other virtual machines or contact support.
translation.create-vm-warning: Your VM will be created with the name
translation.create-vm-ssh-key-subheader: Don't have a key yet? Add one to your
translation.create-vm-gpu-next-step: You can attach a GPU in the next step.
translation.create-deployment-github-subheader: Link your GitHub repo for automatic Continuous Delivery. If not linked, instructions for pushing your container image will be provided later.
translation.resouce-comparison-stateless-frontend: Stateless frontend service: eg. React, AngularJS
translation.resouce-comparison-stateless-backend: Stateless backend service: eg. Express.js, Flask
translation.resouce-comparison-machine-learning-gpu: Machine learning GPU compute: eg. TensorFlow, JupyterLab
translation.resouce-comparison-game-streaming-server: Game streaming server: eg. Steam Remote Play, Parsec
translation.resouce-comparison-real-time-analytics: Real-time analytics: eg. Apache Kafka, Elasticsearch
translation.resouce-comparison-data-processing-pipel: Data processing pipelines: eg. Apache Hadoop, Spark
translation.resouce-comparison-image-processing-serv: Image processing services: eg. Pillow, OpenCV
translation.resouce-comparison-media-streaming-servi: Media streaming services: eg. Plex, Emby
translation.resouce-comparison-serverless-computing-: Serverless computing services: eg. Cloudflare workers
translation.resouce-comparison-iot-data-collection: IoT data collection and processing: eg. MQTT, Node-RED
translation.resouce-comparison-microservice-based-ap: Microservice-based applications: eg. Spring Boot, Django
translation.resouce-comparison-ci-cd-pipelines: Continuous integration and delivery pipelines: eg. Jenkins, GitLab Runner
translation.resouce-comparison-batch-jobs: Batch jobs for data transformation: eg. Talend, Informatica PowerCenter
translation.resouce-comparison-web-scraping-services: Web scraping services: eg. Scrapy, Beautiful Soup
translation.llama-label: What do you want to make? Ask Llama 2:
translation.choose-zone-subheader-1: Your chosen zone determines where your
translation.choose-zone-subheader-2: will be hosted. Selecting the closest zone to your users will improve performance
translation.landing-intro-body: We offer a cutting-edge private cloud infrastructure tailored to meet the unique needs of KTH's bright minds. Seamlessly run experiments, collaborate on groundbreaking research, and harness the power of cloud technology to drive innovation.
translation.landing-intro-footer: Register today free of charge - all you need is a KTH account.
